item.title: Kim add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Freedom is not something that anybody can be given. Freedom is something people take, and people are as free as they want to be" -- James Baldwin

item.title: Kim add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "You can only be young once. But you can always be immature." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Kim add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kim add a quote by Amelia Earhart
item.description: "Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace." -- Amelia Earhart

item.title: Kim add a quote by Amelia Earhart
item.description: "Never interrupt someone doing something you said couldn't be done." -- Amelia Earhart

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure. " -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "We may not pay Satan reverence, for that would be indiscreet, but we can at least respect his talents." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The most interesting information come from children, for they tell all they know and then stop." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kim add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "When trouble arises and things look bad, there is always one individual who perceives a solution and is willing to take command. Very often, that individual is crazy. " -- Dave Barry

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "No matter what happens, somebody will find a way to take it too seriously." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Kim add a quote by Joan of Arc
item.description:
"Every man gives his life for what he believes. Every woman gives her life for what she believes. Sometimes people believe in little or nothing, and so they give their lives to little or nothing. One life is all we have, and we live it as we believe in living it…and then it’s gone.
But to surrender who you are and to live without belief is more terrible than dying – even more terrible than dying young." -- Joan of Arc

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kim add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kim add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Kim add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Kim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kim add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
